pullRequest.title: [mqtt.generic] Add CIE xyY color support
pullRequest.bodyText:
Warning: I think that the changes introduced by this pull request might broke existing MQTT Generic Things, because previous color channels do not exist. ⚠️

This PR adds CIE xyY color support to the MQTT binding.
At the same time, the COLOR_HSB and COLOR_RGB channels have been merged in a single one called COLOR, that receives the color mode as an input parameter.
Comments from @nwpr, @J-N-K, @cpmeister, @jochen314 or @fwolter would be more than welcomed! 😉
Closes #8266
Signed-off-by: Aitor Iturrioz riturrioz@gmail.com

commit.message:
[mqtt.generic] Add CIE xyY color support

Signed-off-by: Aitor Iturrioz <riturrioz@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                            <option value="xyY">CIE xyY</option>
          
          
            
                            <option value="xyY">CIE xyY (x, y, Brightness)</option>
          
      
    
    
  

We should add the values for the xyY colorMode to the color-channel-config, so that people know which values they need for using this colorMode, since the third parameter is not the real Y.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -11,6 +11,17 @@
 				received value is assigned to an item.</description>
 			<advanced>true</advanced>
 		</parameter-group>
+		
+        <parameter name="colorMode" type="text">
+            <label>Color Mode</label>
+            <description>Defines the color representation format of the payload. "HSB" by default.</description>
+            <options>
+                <option value="hsb">HSB (Hue, Saturation, Brightness)</option>
+                <option value="rgb">RGB (Red, Green, Blue)</option>
+                <option value="xyY">CIE xyY</option>

commit.message:
Address review comments

Signed-off-by: Aitor Iturrioz <riturrioz@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText: I would prefere to use an enum for the colorMode here.

commit.message:
Create enum for colorMode

Signed-off-by: Aitor Iturrioz <riturrioz@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText: @J-N-K, @jochen314, should I name it COLOR_MODE or ColorMode? 🤔
Now it is an enum, so we can use ==

We should throw an exception (fail fast).
Returning an empty string will defere the error to a later stage and makes it harder to find the problem
Please use all upper-case for enum members. And as @jochen314 already mentioned: camel-case for the enum-name. Please move the enum to a separate file.
